result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward Rodriguez Montanez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  DNA surcharge and sample are waived.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Criminal Thinking Class.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with the victims (A.K. or M.B.) listed in the criminal complaint, the apartment building at 120 Cambridge Avenue in Waukesha (Case 15CM2211) or any of the co-actors listed in any of cases 15CM2211, 15CM2453 and 16CF246.
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.
Case 16CF470 is dismissed and read in.
Not to use or possess any firearm.

All other outstanding costs/fines/surcharges are converted to a civil judgment.

Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  1 Year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Criminal Thinking Class.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended by the agent;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victims (A.K. or M.B.) listed in the complaint, Apartment Building at 120 Cambridge Avenue in Waukesha (case 15CM2211) or any co-actors listed in any of the files (cases: 15CM2211, 15CM2453 & 16CF246).
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.
Not to use or possess any firearm.

Restitution Requested:  $220 (to be paid to Victim A.K. & M.B.)
Defense is contesting that amount and requesting a restitution hearing.
Court will set a restitution hearing.

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Judicial transfer done pursuant to Chief Judge Order 11-SO-03(67) effective May 1, 2011 related to the assignment of new cases to the judge responsible for any cases currently pending for a defendant.  Cases 'currently' pending include post-judgment matters awaiting sentencing after revocation, modification of sentence, or any other action by a judge.
